Inglis Classic Yearling Sale: Six things we learnt on Day 3
It was another solid day of trade as the 2026 Inglis Classic Yearling Sale came to a close, with a Ghaiyyath colt from Wentwood Grange seizing control and topping the sale at $625,000.
In today's 'The TTR Ten' - Inglis Classic Sales Edition - Steve Vardy from Vardy Thoroughbreds answers 10 rapid-fire questions.

Trade continued at a good pace on the second day of the Inglis Classic Yearling Sale with the gross and clearance rate rising on the same point last year. The full brother to Stretan Angel topped the day at $540,000. TTR runs through five key points of interest from the second day of the Inglis Classic Yearling Sale.
A strong appetite for colts dominated Day 2 of the 2026 Inglis Classic Yearling Sale, with a powerful, mature Harry Angel colt the standout - headlining the session and topping the day at $540,000.

Several Derby prospects put their hands up with wins, but it was Numbers who made it count in the G3 Centenary Vase for Frankie Lor. The former Group 1-placed Australian will head to the Listed Classic Cup next. Jockey Andrea Atzeni had a treble, while trainers Mark Newnham and David Hayes kept each other honest at the top of the Trainer’s Premiership with a winner each.

Several Australian racing and breeding businesses are already saving on administration costs by using offshore businesses to do labour intensive work. With the advent of the internet and remote working, a company like Apteum demonstrates how costs of admin can be lowered while increasing responsiveness in the social media space.
In today's 'The TTR Ten' - Inglis Classic Sales Edition - Adam Watt from Dynamic Thoroughbreds answers 10 rapid-fire questions.

The metrics held steady on Day 1 of the Inglis Classic Yearling Sale with the gross for the day up on the same time last year, while the average and median dropped slightly on 2025 but the average was up on 2024.
